db:abstract.db:para: Description of the Qml Global Object.

db:article.db:para: The QML JavaScript host environment implements the following host objects and functions. They are built-in, so you can use them from any JavaScript code loaded in QML, without additional imports:

db:listitem.db:para: The Qt object: A QML object that offers helper methods and properties specific to the QML environment.
qsTr(), qsTranslate(), qsTrId(), QT_TR_NOOP()(), QT_TRANSLATE_NOOP(), QT_TRID_NOOP() functions: QML functions that let you translate strings and string literals in the QML environment.
gc() function: A QML function that manually triggers garbage collection.
print() function: A QML function that prints output to the console.
The console object: Implements a subset of the FireBug Console API.
XMLHttpRequest, DOMException: Implements a subset of the W3C XMLHttpRequest specification.

db:note.db:para: You cannot use the globalObject() function to change the global object of a QQmlEngine. For more information, see JavaScript Environment Restrictions.
